page.title: 02THAMES-SIDE ECOLOGY
page.content: Primary major land-cover is rough uncultivated marshy grassland interspersed with dykes and footpaths. Cattle and sheep graze on enclosed grassland. It is an ideal habitat for birds,butterflies and other wildlife. As there are few metalled roads in this area vehicles are usually farm tractors. However there are several excellent footpaths, including the Saxon Shore Way ,clearly marked with a Saxon's helmet symbol, making this an attractive an interesting area for walkers and students of natural history. The{Saxon Shore Way}follows the North Kent coastline along the bank of the{River Thames} as it flows between Kent and Essex on its way to the North Sea. One square kilometre southwest of{Shornemead Fort}is closed to the public when the army is using the nearby firing range.
